intro: Fumaria parviflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved fumitory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. This annual herb thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
